docs.lead_paragraph: Facing pitiful poll numbers, Francois Hollande has cast his lot: The French president who once decried global finance and vowed a 75-percent tax on millionaires has quashed dissent from his Socialist government's left flank and appointed a well-heeled former investment banker as his new point man on the economy.

headline.main: French Leader Banks on Free Market to Save Economy
headline.print_headline: French Leader Banks on Free Market to Save Economy

docs.snippet: Facing pitiful poll numbers, Francois Hollande has cast his lot: The French president who once decried global finance and vowed a 75-percent tax on millionaires has quashed dissent from his Socialist government's left flank and appointed a...

docs.lead_paragraph: Why are women doing most of the work on so many urban farms?
docs.abstract: Work on New York's nearly 900 food gardens and urban farms is primarily done by women, raising questions of whether it is stereotypes or willingness to nurture communities that are reason for such uneven staffing; advocates of urban farming wonder how gender disparity will affect movement's farming model, mission and pay structures.
docs.snippet: Why are women doing most of the work on so many urban farms?

docs.lead_paragraph: New Zealand's Fonterra may consider additional partnerships with Chinese dairy companies in the future, but not those involved in the infant formula market, Chief Executive Theo Spierings told Reuters on Wednesday.

headline.main: Fonterra Sees Scope for More China Partnerships
headline.print_headline: Fonterra Sees Scope for More China Partnerships

docs.snippet: New Zealand's Fonterra may consider additional partnerships with Chinese dairy companies in the future, but not those involved in the infant formula market, Chief Executive Theo Spierings told Reuters on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Venezuela's socialist government is sounding the alarm about growing waistlines in a country where record food shortages are making it harder to put healthy meals on the table, prompting many people to fill up on empty calories.

headline.main: Venezuela Battles Obesity Amid Dearth of Good Food
headline.print_headline: Venezuela Battles Obesity Amid Dearth of Good Food

docs.snippet: Venezuela's socialist government is sounding the alarm about growing waistlines in a country where record food shortages are making it harder to put healthy meals on the table, prompting many people to fill up on empty calories.

docs.lead_paragraph: We fear alcohol’s bad effects too much, and those of food too little.
docs.abstract: Mark Bittman Op-Ed column examines cultural attitudes toward drinking, and disputes notion that anyone drinks alcohol moderately for health benefits; notes discrepancy in way drinking alcohol and eating food are treated by health community, as dangers of alcohol are widely known and warned against, whereas dangers of bad diets are not.
docs.snippet: We fear alcohol’s bad effects too much, and those of food too little.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: A Navy nurse who was the first, and apparently only, member of the medical staff at Guantanamo to refuse to take part in the feeding of hunger striking prisoners has had his assignment cut short at the U.S. base in Cuba, officials said Tuesday.

headline.main: US Navy Pulls Protesting Nurse From Guantanamo
headline.print_headline: US Navy Pulls Protesting Nurse From Guantanamo

docs.snippet: A Navy nurse who was the first, and apparently only, member of the medical staff at Guantanamo to refuse to take part in the feeding of hunger striking prisoners has had his assignment cut short at the U.S. base in Cuba, officials said Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Matt Kenseth, championship-winning race car driver, can now add a children's book to his resume.

docs.lead_paragraph: They look different, but the difference in nutritional value between the different-colored eggs is negligible.

headline.main: Don’t Judge Them by Their Shells
headline.print_headline: Don’t Judge Them by Their Shells

docs.abstract: Science Q&A on whether there is a nutritional difference between brown and white eggs.

docs.lead_paragraph: It’s a cliché but true: Moderation is the best bet in health, and that includes the sometimes too-dire recommendations of doctors.

headline.main: Dash of Salt Does No Harm. Extremes Are the Enemy.
headline.print_headline: A Dash of Salt Does No Harm. Extremes Are the Enemy.

docs.abstract: The Upshot column; studies published in New England Journal of Medicine confirm old cliche that moderation is one's best bet in health, and that applies to sometimes extreme recommendations of doctors; cites low salt diets.
docs.snippet: It’s a cliché but true: Moderation is the best bet in health, and that includes the sometimes too-dire recommendations of doctors.

docs.lead_paragraph: Spinning in 70 mph second serves, grabbing at his hamstring during points, Andy Murray gritted his way through head-to-toe cramps to win at the U.S. Open.

headline.main: Murray Grits Through Cramps to Win at US Open
headline.print_headline: Murray Grits Through Cramps to Win at US Open

docs.snippet: Spinning in 70 mph second serves, grabbing at his hamstring during points, Andy Murray gritted his way through head-to-toe cramps to win at the U.S. Open.
